schema.description: Expected response body of fulfillment simulation

country.description: ISO 3-digit code of the country where the delivery address is located. If you don’t want to send it, use the value null.
country.title: Country

items.description: Contains the data about each SKU in the cart.
Contains the data about each SKU in the cart.

listPrice.description: List price. It’s the amount presented to the customer as a “previous” price that has been lowered due to a discount. Don’t separate the decimal places. The last two digits are the cents.
listPrice.title: listPrice

merchantName.description: Name of the marketplace, used to guide payments. This field should be nulled if the marketplace is responsible for processing payments. Check out our [​​Payments in VTEX marketplaces](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/payments-in-vtex-marketplaces--2kYOfWCZYweJkYl18bw9yD) article to know more.
merchantName.title: merchantName

offerings.description: Services that may be offered for this SKU. example are the assembly of a piece of furniture or warranty. In case these information are sent, the following fields are mandatory. If you don’t want to send it, use an empty array.

items.description: Services that may be offered for this SKU. example are the assembly of a piece of furniture or warranty. In case these information are sent, the following fields are mandatory. If you don’t want to send it, use an empty array.

price.description: Service price. The last two digits are the cents.
price.title: price

items.title: offerings

offerings.title: offerings

price.description: Actual selling price of the SKU. Don’t separate the decimal places. The last two digits are the cents.
price.title: price

priceTags.description: List with the promotions applied to the SKU.
priceTags.title: priceTags

priceValidUntil.description: Expiration date of the SKU price. Example: `2014-03-01T22:58:28.143`. In case you don’t want to send it, use the value null.
priceValidUntil.title: priceValidUntil

quantity.description: Quantity of the item. The seller should send the quantity that was indicated in the request, or the maximum quantity possible.
quantity.title: quantity

requestIndex.description: Position of this item in the original array (request).
requestIndex.title: requestIndex

seller.description: ID of the seller as registered in VTEX. You should send the same value that came in the request.
seller.title: seller

unitMultiplier.description: SKU unit multiplier. The default value is 1.
unitMultiplier.title: unitMultiplier

items.title: Items
Items

logisticsInfo.description: Array that contains the data regarding the delivery methods and stock for each item. If all products are unavailable, this field should return empty.

items.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

deliveryChannels.description: Array contains the stock balance for each channel.

items.description: Object containing ID and stockbalance of each delivery channel.

id.description: Identifies the channel type whose stock balance will be informed in the next field. Possible values are: pickup-in-point for pickup point and delivery for regular delivery.
id.title: id

stockBalance.description: Stock balance for the channel type selected in the previous field.
stockBalance.title: stockBalance

items.title: deliveryChannels

deliveryChannels.title: deliveryChannels

itemIndex.description: Position of this item in the original array, i.e., in the array that came with the request. This index is what identifies which SKU you are referring to for each object inside the logisticsInfo.
itemIndex.title: itemIndex

quantity.description: Quantity of the item. The seller should send the quantity that was indicated in the request, or the maximum quantity possible.
quantity.title: quantity

shipsTo.description: ISO 3-digit code of the countries to where the SKU is delivered.
shipsTo.title: shipsTo

address.reference: Right next to the Unicorn statue.
Right next to the Unicorn statue.

availableDeliveryWindows.description: Contains the delivery windows available for the SLA.

endDateUtc.description: End date of the delivery window.
endDateUtc.title: endDateUtc

price.description: Extra price for scheduled delivery. The last two digits are the cents.
price.title: price

startDateUtc.description: Start date of the delivery window.
startDateUtc.title: startDateUtc

availableDeliveryWindows.title: availableDeliveryWindows

deliveryChannel.description: Type of delivery channel. The values that are possible are: `pickup-in-point` for pickup point and `delivery` for regular delivery.
deliveryChannel.title: deliveryChannel

pickupStoreInfo.description: Contains the data about the pickup point. If you don’t want to send this, use the value `null`.

address.reference: Right next to the Unicorn statue.

additionalInfo.description: Description or extra information about the pickup point.
additionalInfo.example: Pick up your order at the cashier.
additionalInfo.title: additionalInfo

address.description: Address data of the pickup point.

example.reference: Right next to the Unicorn statue.

complement.description: Complement of the pickup point address.
complement.title: complement

country.description: 3-digit ISO code of the country where the pickup point is located.
country.title: country

geoCoordinates.description: Contains the geographic coordinates of the pickup point.

items.description: Contains the geographic coordinates of the pickup point.
items.title: geoCoordinates

geoCoordinates.title: geoCoordinates

neighborhood.description: Neighborhood where the pickup point is located.
neighborhood.title: neighborhood

number.description: Address number of the pickup point.
number.title: number

postalCode.description: Postal code of the pickup point. This field is mandatory, for shopping carts simulations, where both Country and Postal Code are required. This field should be sent as `null` for storefront simulations, where the information is not necessary.
postalCode.title: postalCode

receiverName.description: Name of the person who will receive the product. May be sent as `null`.
receiverName.title: receiverName

reference.description: A reference for the pickup point address.
reference.example: Right next to the Unicorn statue.
reference.title: reference

street.description: Street where the pickup point is located.
street.title: street

address.title: address

friendlyName.description: Friendly name of the pickup point.
friendlyName.title: friendlyName

isPickupStore.description: `true` if it is a pickup point.
isPickupStore.title: isPickupStore

pickupStoreInfo.title: pickupStoreInfo

price.description: Delivery price. The two last digits are the cents.
price.title: price

shippingEstimate.description: Time estimated for the delivery. Possible suffixes are `bd` for *business day* , `h` for *hours*, and `m` for *minutes*.
shippingEstimate.title: shippingEstimate

items.title: A Schema

logisticsInfo.title: logisticsInfo

postalCode.description: Postal code of the delivery address. This field is mandatory, for shopping carts simulations, where both Country and Postal Code are required. This field should be sent as `null` for storefront simulations, where the information is not necessary.
postalCode.title: postalCode

schema.title: Response body

mappings.name: Authorize dispatch for fulfillment order - response

accountName.description: String that indicates which account made the request.

code.description: String with a internal Channel Order API code that classifies the response. The possible values returned in this field are described in the Response Codes section of this API Reference.

errors.description: List with errors related to the response, if there is any.

code.description: String containing the code returned by the source. Example value: If the source is `Fulfillment`, the code can be FMT005 to indicate that the item(s) in the order are not available.
code.title: code

description.description: String containing the error message/description returned by the source.
description.title: description

source.description:
Includes the following fields pointing out the context of the error: 

`Fulfillment` 

`Checkout` 

`Order Integration`
source.title: Checkout

fields.description:
Structure with important fields for the connector. This structure is only returned if the response is successful. Includes the following fields: 

`mainOrderId`: String with the order's ID inside the main seller account in VTEX. 

`franchiseOrderId`: - String with the order's ID inside the franchise seller account in VTEX. Only returned if the order was integrated using the [Multilevel Omnichannel Inventory](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/multilevel-omnichannel-inventory--7M1xyCZWUyCB7PcjNtOyw4) feature, that is: 

- `allowFranchises` field set to `true` when integrating the order 

- `SLA` chosen for the order is from a franchise account.

franchiseOrderId.description:
String with the order's ID inside the franchise seller account in VTEX. Only returned if the order was integrated using the [Multilevel Omnichannel Inventory](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/multilevel-omnichannel-inventory--7M1xyCZWUyCB7PcjNtOyw4) feature, that is: 

- `allowFranchises` field set to `true` when integrating the order 
- SLA chosen for the order is from a franchise account
franchiseOrderId.title: The franchiseOrderId Schema

mainOrderId.description: String with the order’s ID inside the main seller account in VTEX.
mainOrderId.title: The mainOrderId Schema

flow.description:
String containing the name of the flow responsible for the response. This field can contain the following values: 

`PlaceOrder`: when integrating new orders. 

`ApproveOrder`: when approving existing orders. 

`Unknown`: when we’re not able to identify the flow.

marketplaceOrderId.description: String that indicates the order's ID in the marketplace.

message.description: String with a message explaining the code returned in the response.
message.example: The order was integrated into VTEX successfully

operationId.description: String GUID that identifies the operation in our service. This field can be used to help us analyze unexpected errors or behaviors.

success.description: Boolean that indicates if the response is successful or not.

accountName.description: String that indicates which account made the request.

code.description: String with a internal Channel Order API code that classifies the response. The possible values returned in this field are described in the [Response Codes]() section.

errors.description: List with errors related to the response, if there's any.

code.description: String containing the code returned by the source. Example value: If the source is `Fulfillment`, the code can be FMT005 to indicate that the item(s) in the order are not available.
code.title: code

description.description: String containing the error message/description returned by the source.
description.title: description

source.description:
Includes the following fields pointing out the context of the error: 

`Fulfillment` 

`Checkout` 

`Order Integration`
source.title: Checkout

fields.description:
Structure with important fields for the connector. This structure is only returned if the response is successful. Includes the following fields: 

`mainOrderId`: String with the order's ID inside the main seller account in VTEX. 

`franchiseOrderId`: - String with the order's ID inside the franchise seller account in VTEX. Only returned if the order was integrated using the [Multilevel Omnichannel Inventory](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/multilevel-omnichannel-inventory--7M1xyCZWUyCB7PcjNtOyw4) feature, that is: 

- `allowFranchises` field set to `true` when integrating the order 

- `SLA` chosen for the order is from a franchise account.

franchiseOrderId.description:
String with the order's ID inside the franchise seller account in VTEX. Only returned if the order was integrated using the [Multilevel Omnichannel Inventory](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/multilevel-omnichannel-inventory--7M1xyCZWUyCB7PcjNtOyw4) feature, that is: 

- `allowFranchises` field set to `true` when integrating the order 
- SLA chosen for the order is from a franchise account
franchiseOrderId.title: franchiseOrderId

mainOrderId.description: String with the order’s ID inside the main seller account in VTEX.
mainOrderId.title: mainOrderId

flow.description:
String containing the name of the flow responsible for the response. This field can contain the following values: 

`PlaceOrder`: when integrating new orders 

`ApproveOrder`: when approving existing orders 

`Unknown`: when we’re not able to identify the flow

marketplaceOrderId.description: String that indicates the order's ID in the marketplace.

message.description: String with a message explaining the code returned in the response.
message.example: The order was integrated into VTEX successfully

operationId.description: String GUID that identifies the operation in our service. This field can be used to help us analyze unexpected errors or behaviors.

success.description: Boolean that indicates if the response is successful or not.

country.description: Three letter ISO code of the country of the shipping address.

items.description: Information on each item in the cart.

priceDefinition.description: Price information for all units of a specific item.

calculatedSellingPrice.description: Item's calculated unitary selling price in cents.

sellingPrices.description: Array of objects, each containing value (in cents) and quantity for the different rounding instances that can be combined to form the correctly rounded total.

quantity.description: Rounding quantity, meaning how many items are rounded to this value.

value.description: Value in cents for that specific rounding.

total.description: Total value for all units of the item in cents.

priceTags.description: Array of price tags, each of which, modifies the price in some way, like discounts or rates that apply to the item in the context of the order.

isPercentual.description: Indicates whether price tag value is applied through a percentage.

owner.description: Identification of the responsible for the price tag.

quantity.description: The quantity of the item the cart.

seller.description: The seller responsible for the SKU.

sellerChain.description: Sellers involved in the chain. The list should contain only one seller, unless it is a [Multilevel Omnichannel Inventory](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/multilevel-omnichannel-inventory--7M1xyCZWUyCB7PcjNtOyw4) order.

sellingPrice.description: Selling price in cents. Note that this field may be subject to rounding discrepancies. We recommend retrieving data from the `priceDefinition` data structure instead.

logisticsInfo.description: Array with logistics information on each item of the `items` array in the `orderForm`.

itemIndex.description: Index of item in items array.

items.description: List of objects containing metadata on each item in the order.

required.description: Indicates whether the item is required.

messages.description: Array containing an object for each message generated by our servers while processing the request.

itemPurchaseConditions.description: List of objects containing purchase condition information on each item in the order.

sellerChain.description: Sellers involved in the chain. The list should contain only one seller, unless it is a [Multilevel Omnichannel Inventory](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/multilevel-omnichannel-inventory--7M1xyCZWUyCB7PcjNtOyw4) order.

availableDeliveryWindows.description: This object contains information about the delivery window available to the shopper.

endDateUtc.description: Delivery window ending day and time in UTC.

startDateUtc.description: Delivery window starting day and time in UTC.

deliveryWindow.description: In case of scheduled delivery, this object will contain information on the delivery window selected by the shopper.

endDateUtc.description: Delivery window ending day and time in UTC.

startDateUtc.description: Delivery window starting day and time in UTC.

isPickupStore.description: Indicates whether it is the pickup store.

shippingEstimate.description: Shipping estimate. For instance, "three business days" will be represented as `3bd`.

transitTime.description: Transit time. For instance, "three business days" is represented as `3bd`.

selectedDeliveryChannel.description: Delivery channel selected by the customer. For example, `"delivery"` or `"pickup-in-point"`.

shipsTo.description: List of countries that the item may be shipped to.

availableDeliveryWindows.description: This object contains information about the delivery window available to the shopper.

endDateUtc.description: Delivery window ending day and time in UTC.

startDateUtc.description: Delivery window starting day and time in UTC.

deliveryWindow.description: In case of scheduled delivery, this object will contain information on the delivery window selected by the shopper.

endDateUtc.description: Delivery window ending day and time in UTC.

startDateUtc.description: Delivery window starting day and time in UTC.

isPickupStore.description: Indicates whether it is the pickup store.

shippingEstimate.description: Shipping estimate. For instance, "three business days" will be represented as `3bd`.

transitTime.description: Transit time. For instance, "three business days" is represented as `3bd`.

marketingData.description: Object containing promotion data such as coupon tracking information and internal or external UTMs.

giftCards.description: Gift card information, if it applies to the order.

hasInterestRate.description: Indicates whether the payment has interest.

total.description: Total value of the order without separating cents. For example, $24.99 is represented `2499`.

value.description: Value of the order without the interest rate. The value is shown without separating cents.
Total value assigned to this payment.

displayDocument.description: Indicates whether a document is shown.

requiresAuthentication.description: Indicates whether a authentication is required.

requiresDocument.description: Indicates whether a document is required.

ratesAndBenefitsData.description: Information on rates and benefits that apply to the order.

rateAndBenefitsIdentifiers.description: List with rates and benefits identifiers.

teaser.description: List with rates and benefits teasers.

selectableGifts.description: Array containing the data of the item selected as a gift.
